characters.name: Fluttershy
characters.description: Fluttershy is a female Pegasus pony and one of the main characters of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She lives in a small cottage near the Everfree Forest and takes care of animals, the most prominent of her charges being Angel the bunny. She represents the element of kindness.

characters.name: Rainbow Dash
characters.description: Rainbow Dash is a female Pegasus pony and one of the main characters in My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She maintains the weather and clears the skies in Ponyville. As a huge fan of the Wonderbolts, she becomes a reservist member of the elite flying group in Testing Testing 1, 2, 3 and a full member in Newbie Dash. In Sonic Rainboom, Rarity and Princess Celestia both declare that she is the best flier in all of Equestria. Rainbow Dash has a pet tortoise named Tank, whom she chooses out of Fluttershy's offered animals in the episode May the Best Pet Win! She represents the element of loyalty.

characters.name: Blossomforth
characters.description: Blossomforth is a Pegasus pony who appears in the episodes Hurricane Fluttershy, Rainbow Falls, Inspiration Manifestation, and The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows and in the IDW comics' Friends Forever Issue #9. She has a very light pink coat, a mane streaked cerise and mint green, bright blue eyes, and a cutie mark of two flowers. She shares her design, eye color, and in some merchandise cutie mark with Helia and has a mane design similar to Twilight Sparkle, Sweetcream Scoops, and Lovestruck.

characters.name: Bow Hothoof
characters.description: Bow Hothoof and Windy Whistles are the married Pegasus pony parents of Rainbow Dash. They first appear in the season seven episode Parental Glideance and are alluded to in other media.

characters.name: Clear Skies
characters.description: Sunshower, Open Skies, Clear Skies, and Fluffy Clouds are four Pegasus ponies who first appear in the season five episode Tanks for the Memories; Fluffy Clouds later appears in Princess Spike and Celestial Advice. Fluffy Clouds is called Fluffy Cloudsdale in some merchandise.

characters.name: Cloud Chaser
characters.description: The name Cloud Chaser is used to refer to two separate characters: a female Pegasus pony and a male Pegasus pony.

characters.name: Crafty Crate
characters.description: Crafty Crate, or Ship Shape, is a male Pegasus pony with a brown coat, pale gold mane, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a crate. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise. He has a speaking role in Putting Your Hoof Down.

characters.name: Daring Do
characters.description: Daring Do, or Daring Do Dazzle, also known as A.K. Yearling, is a female Pegasus pony, the titular character and the author of the Daring Do book series, based on her adventures. She first appears in storybook form in the season two episode Read It and Weep and physically debuts in the season four episode Daring Don't.

characters.name:
Smug Bully
Dumb-Bell
characters.description: The Boy Bullies are a group of up to three male Pegasi, including Hoops, Dumb-bell, and Score, who have picked on Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy, calling them respectively "Rainbow Crash" and "Klutzershy". The three first appear as grown stallions in the season one episode Sonic Rainboom, and they make varying appearances as stallions and colts in later episodes, chapter books, and IDW comics. The two other than Hoops are not named in the show, but the three's collective title and individual names are given in merchandise.

characters.name: Feather Flatterfly
characters.description: The coordinator of the Cloudsdale Pegasi weather team in The Summer Sun Setback. Also appears in The Ending of the End - Part 2. His cutie mark is a weather vane. Voiced by Sam Vincent.

characters.name: Flash Magnus
characters.description: Flash Magnus is a male Pegasus pony and figure of Equestrian legend. He makes his first appearance in My Little Pony: Legends of Magic Issue #4 and his first in-show appearance in the season seven episode Campfire Tales.

characters.name: Flash Sentry
characters.description: Flash Sentry is a male Pegasus pony who first appears in My Little Pony Equestria Girls as a Crystal Empire royal guard. Following his appearance in Equestria Girls, he has since appeared in series episodes and several IDW comics.

characters.name: Flitter
characters.description: Flitter is a grayish blue Pegasus pony who wears a pink bow in her mane; she has a slightly slurred accent. Her cutie mark is three blue and white dragonflies, although the number of dragonflies changes sometimes.

characters.name:
Sad Delegate
Fluffy Clouds
characters.description: Sunshower, Open Skies, Clear Skies, and Fluffy Clouds are four Pegasus ponies who first appear in the season five episode Tanks for the Memories; Fluffy Clouds later appears in Princess Spike and Celestial Advice. Fluffy Clouds is called Fluffy Cloudsdale in some merchandise.

characters.name: Flutterholly
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tale". Shares her depiction with Fluttershy. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "Yes, that's 'Flutterholly' and not 'Fluttershy.' Are you sure you don't have something stuck in your eye?" Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria expansion set card #49 C of Fluttershy as Flutterholly gives her the description "Most ponies think that winter is Flutterholly's least favorite season, but they have no idea how much she loves sitting by the fire and knitting for hours on end."

characters.name: Prince Hisan
characters.description: Appears in Daring Done? as the prince of a village and son of the pharaoh in Somnambula's legend. Also appears in My Little Pony: Legends of Magic Issue #5 and Issue #10. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Hoops
characters.description: The Boy Bullies are a group of up to three male Pegasi, including Hoops, Dumb-bell, and Score, who have picked on Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy, calling them respectively "Rainbow Crash" and "Klutzershy". The three first appear as grown stallions in the season one episode Sonic Rainboom, and they make varying appearances as stallions and colts in later episodes, chapter books, and IDW comics. The two other than Hoops are not named in the show, but the three's collective title and individual names are given in merchandise.

characters.name: Inky Rose
characters.description: Lily Lace, Starstreak, and Inky Rose are three fashion designer ponies who appear in the season seven episode Honest Apple as contestants in Rarity's Carousel Boutique Couture du Future Fashion Contest.

characters.name: Commander Ironhead
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales, My Little Pony: Legends of Magic Issue #4, and Legends of Magic Annual 2018 as the leader of the Cloudsdale Royal Legion. Voiced by Paul Dobson. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Auntie Lofty
characters.description: Aunt Holiday and Auntie Lofty are an Earth pony and Pegasus romantic couple and the aunts of Scootaloo. They first appear in the chapter book Ponyville Mysteries: Riddle of the Rusty Horseshoe, and they make physical appearances in My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #3 and the season nine episode The Last Crusade.

characters.name: Lucy Packard
characters.description: The backstage manager at the Best Young Flyer competition in Sonic Rainboom. Speaks with a New Yorker accent. Her cutie mark is three tornadoes. Also appears as a unicorn with a carrot cutie mark in Putting Your Hoof Down, with no cutie mark in The Perfect Pear, and in Yakity-Sax. Named in The Wonderbolts Academy Handbook. Voiced by Kathleen Barr in Sonic Rainboom. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Mane Allgood
characters.description: Snap Shutter and Mane Allgood are an Earth pony/Pegasus duo of world travelers/adventurers and the married parents of Scootaloo. They are first mentioned in the chapter book Ponyville Mysteries: Riddle of the Rusty Horseshoe, and they make their physical debut in the season nine episode The Last Crusade.

characters.name:
Fluttershy's father
Mr. Shy
characters.description: Mr. and Mrs. Shy are the married Pegasus pony parents of Fluttershy and Zephyr Breeze who first appear in the season six episode Flutter Brutter.

characters.name:
Fluttershy's mother
Mrs. Shy
characters.description: Mr. and Mrs. Shy are the married Pegasus pony parents of Fluttershy and Zephyr Breeze who first appear in the season six episode Flutter Brutter.

characters.name: Night Glider
characters.description: Night Glider is a female Pegasus pony who first appears in the season five premiere. She is a resident of a village, led by Starlight Glimmer, in which its inhabitants have all given up their cutie marks. In the episodes in which she appears, Night Glider is never referred to by name, being named only in the credits and in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Open Skies
characters.description: Sunshower, Open Skies, Clear Skies, and Fluffy Clouds are four Pegasus ponies who first appear in the season five episode Tanks for the Memories; Fluffy Clouds later appears in Princess Spike and Celestial Advice. Fluffy Clouds is called Fluffy Cloudsdale in some merchandise.

characters.name: Rainbow Dash
characters.description: Rainbow Dash's human counterpart appears in the My Little Pony Equestria Girls franchise. She is a student at Canterlot High School and electric guitarist/lead vocalist for the Rainbooms.

characters.name: Pegasus royal guards
characters.description: royal guards, some also referred to as the E.U.P. (Earth, Unicorn, Pegasus) Guard of the Protective Pony Platoons, are various groups of armored ponies, griffons, Hippogriffs, or gargoyles that serve various members of royalty. They act as bodyguards, ceremonial guards in festivities, soldiers, and chauffeurs on several occasions. The guards are generally shown wearing extremely serious expressions and usually don't speak, but when they do, their voice is provided by Jayson Thiessen, Andrew Francis, Peter New, Ian Hanlin, Brian Drummond, Jason Simpson and/or Scott Underwood. Their cutie marks are obscured by their uniforms.

characters.name: Snowdash
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tale". Shares her depiction with Rainbow Dash. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "Work on Hearth’s Warming? She’s sure to say 'no' -- this pony would rather be dashing through snow!" Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria expansion set card #9 C of Rainbow Dash as Snowdash lists the quote "Ever since Snowfall Frost figured out how cool Hearth's Warming is, I went from no vacation time to two weeks a year, plus paid sick days! I think it's time to ask for that raise..."

characters.name: Somnambula
characters.description: Somnambula (/sɒmˈnæmbjuːlə/, sahm-NAM-byoo-luh) is a female Pegasus and figure of Equestrian legend first mentioned in season six's The Crystalling - Part 2. She makes her first appearance in the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Legends of Magic Issue #5 and her first in-show appearance in the season seven episode Daring Done?

characters.name: Songbird Serenade
characters.description: Songbird Serenade is a female Pegasus pony who appears as a supporting character in My Little Pony The Movie, a central character in the chapter book Beyond Equestria: Pinkie Pie Steps Up, and in the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #5. She is the biggest pop star in Equestria and the headlining act for the Friendship Festival.

characters.name:
Castle Guard 2
Spearhead
characters.description: Spearhead is a male Pegasus pony and supporting character who appears in the season five episode Rarity Investigates! and the season seven episode A Flurry of Emotions. He is a Canterlot royal guard-turned-artist and an old friend of Shining Armor's.

characters.name: Stellar Eclipse
characters.description: Stellar Eclipse is a male Pegasus who appears in Trade Ya! He has a milk chocolate brown coat, black and purple striped mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of usually a sun symbol consisting of a pink circle surrounded by eight triangles; four large, purple ones, and four small, light pink ones -- in one shot, his cutie mark appears as an hourglass. He walks with a wheelchair cart.

characters.name: Stormy Flare
characters.description: Spitfire's mother who appears in Rarity Investigates! Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", S07E20 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is an orange rocket. Voiced by Sidika Larbes. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Sunshower
characters.description: Sunshower, Open Skies, Clear Skies, and Fluffy Clouds are four Pegasus ponies who first appear in the season five episode Tanks for the Memories; Fluffy Clouds later appears in Princess Spike and Celestial Advice. Fluffy Clouds is called Fluffy Cloudsdale in some merchandise.

characters.name: Windy Whistles
characters.description: Bow Hothoof and Windy Whistles are the married Pegasus pony parents of Rainbow Dash. They first appear in the season seven episode Parental Glideance and are alluded to in other media.

characters.name: Zephyr Breeze
characters.description: Zephyr Breeze is a male Pegasus pony and Fluttershy's younger brother who first appears in the season six episode Flutter Brutter.

characters.name: Fleetfoot
characters.description: Fleetfoot is a female Pegasus pony and a member of the aerial acrobatics group, the Wonderbolts. She first appears in The Best Night Ever, and she is first mentioned by name in Sweet and Elite.

characters.name: Soarin
characters.description: Soarin, or Soarin', is a male Pegasus pony and a member of the Wonderbolts. He appears in multiple episodes of the series, making his debut in The Ticket Master, in Rainbow Dash's fantasy. Soarin makes his speaking debut in The Best Night Ever, which is also where his name is mentioned by Spitfire, the captain of the Wonderbolts. He also appears to have a huge love for apple pie, as seen in The Best Night Ever. The shoulder boards on his shirt in A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 signify he is a commander of the Wonderbolts, and as second-in-command, issues orders when Spitfire is absent in Rarity Investigates!

characters.name: Spitfire
characters.description: Spitfire is a female Pegasus pony and the captain of the aerial acrobatics group, the Wonderbolts. She makes her debut in Sonic Rainboom and her name is first used in The Best Night Ever. She and Soarin are the first two members of the Wonderbolts to be named on the show. Spitfire is a term denoting a person with a fierce temper. The Supermarine Spitfire is also the name of an iconic British-produced, high-performance Allied fighter aircraft used in the Second World War.

characters.name: Blaze
characters.description: Blaze is a female Pegasus pony and a member of the aerial acrobatics group, the Wonderbolts. She first appears in The Ticket Master, and she has a speaking role in Rarity Investigates!

characters.name: Fire Streak
characters.description: Fire Streak, or Lightning Dash, is a male Pegasus pony and a retired member of the aerial acrobatics group, the Wonderbolts. He first appears in the season one episode Sonic Rainboom. He is named Fire Streak in Newbie Dash and Parental Glideance, and he is named both Fire Streak and Lightning Dash in merchandise.

characters.name: High Winds
characters.description: High Winds is a female Pegasus pony and a member of the aerial acrobatics group, the Wonderbolts. She first appears in The Best Night Ever, and she has a brief speaking role in Newbie Dash. She is not named in the show, credited only as "Wonderbolt 2" in Newbie Dash, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Lightning Streak
characters.description: A male Wonderbolt in the V.I.P. section in The Best Night Ever. Also appears in Rarity Investigates!, Newbie Dash, Marks and Recreation, Secrets and Pies, The Washouts, and The Ending of the End - Part 2, and depicted in photograph in Top Bolt. Shares his coat and mane colors with "Sun Chaser". Named in both the Wonderbolts Cloudsdale Mini Collection and The Wonderbolts Academy Handbook; the name is mentioned without individual identification in The Elements of Harmony.

characters.name: Misty Fly
characters.description: Misty Fly is a female Pegasus pony and a member of the aerial acrobatics group, the Wonderbolts. She first appears in Sonic Rainboom, and she has speaking roles in Rarity Investigates!, Newbie Dash, Top Bolt, and Grannies Gone Wild. She is named Icy Mist in some merchandise.

characters.name: Silver Zoom
characters.description: Silver Zoom, or Silver Lining, is a male Pegasus pony and a member of the aerial acrobatics group, the Wonderbolts. He first appears in the season one episode Sonic Rainboom. He is not named in the show, but he is named varyingly in merchandise.

characters.name: Sun Chaser
characters.description: A member of the Wonderbolts who appears in Rarity Investigates! Shares her design with High Winds and her coat and mane colors with Lightning Streak.

characters.name: Surprise
characters.description: Surprise is a female Pegasus pony and a member of the aerial acrobatics group, the Wonderbolts. She first appears in The Ticket Master, and she has a speaking role in Newbie Dash, My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #8, and My Little Pony Annual 2017. She is not named in the show, credited only as "Wonderbolt 1" in Newbie Dash, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Thunderlane
characters.description: Thunderlane is a male Pegasus pony who first appears in the episode Hurricane Fluttershy. He has a dark gray coat, amber eyes and a blue-silver mane. His cutie mark is a storm cloud with a lightning bolt descending from it. He shares his design and eye color with Stormbreaker. He is Rumble's older brother.

characters.name: Wave Chill
characters.description: A male member of the Wonderbolts. Appears at the very end of Sonic Rainboom to accompany Rainbow Dash to her Wonderbolts meeting, but is not among the Wonderbolt judges who perform the stunt at the beginning of the competition earlier in the episode. Also appears in The Best Night Ever, Rarity Investigates!, and the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #10 page 19. Resembles Soarin, "Descent", and S05E15 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1. Named in both the Wonderbolts Cloudsdale Mini Collection and The Wonderbolts Academy Handbook; the name is mentioned without individual identification in The Elements of Harmony.

characters.name: Wind Waker
characters.description: A member of the Wonderbolts who appears in Newbie Dash, Secrets and Pies, The Washouts, and The Ending of the End - Part 2. Shares his design, coat, and eye color with Fire Streak and his design with S09E26 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #1.

characters.name: Wind Rider
characters.description: Wind Rider is a male Pegasus pony and the antagonist of the season five episode Rarity Investigates! He is a retired member of the Wonderbolts who frames Rainbow Dash for a crime to preserve his long-distance speed record.

characters.name: S05E15 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1
characters.description: A member of the Wonderbolts who briefly appears in Rarity Investigates! talking to Shooting Star. Resembles Wave Chill, shares her design with Blaze, Surprise, and "Nightingale", and has a similar color scheme to Soarin.

characters.name:
Swishy-Haired Future Wonderbolt
S09E26 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #4
characters.description: Appears in The Last Problem as a future member of the Wonderbolts. Shares her design with Fleetfoot. She is a character named "Swishy-Haired Future Wonderbolt" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Wonderbolt for a Day" event. Her in-game bio states "The Wonderbolts of days yet to come are just as daring as their predecessors--but with more access to advanced future styling gel."

characters.name:
Poofy-Haired Future Wonderbolt
S09E26 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #5
characters.description: Appears in The Last Problem as a future member of the Wonderbolts. She is a character named "Poofy-Haired Future Wonderbolt" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Wonderbolt for a Day" event. Her in-game bio states "The Wonderbolts of days-yet-to-come are just as daring as their predecessors--and sometimes, they have even poofier hair."

characters.name:
Pompadoured Future Wonderbolt
S09E26 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #1
characters.description: Appears in The Last Problem as a future member of the Wonderbolts. Shares his design with Fire Streak and "Wind Waker". He is a character named "Swishy-Haired Future Wonderbolt" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Wonderbolt for a Day" event. His in-game bio states "The Wonderbolts of days yet to come are just as daring as their predecessors--but they still like to rock a retro 'do every now and then."

characters.name:
Swooshy-Haired Future Wonderbolt
S09E26 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #2
characters.description: Appears in The Last Problem as a future member of the Wonderbolts. He is a character named "Swooshy-Haired Future Wonderbolt" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Wonderbolt for a Day" event. His in-game bio states "The Wonderbolts of days-yet-to-come are just as daring as their predecessors--and on occasion, they have even swoopier mane-dos."

characters.name: Fast Clip
characters.description: Fast Clip and Whiplash are two male Pegasus ponies who first appear in Wonderbolts Academy as Spitfire's fellow academy drill instructors. They are unnamed in the show, but they are named in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name:
Cloudsdale Cheer Pony
Lilac Sky
characters.description: Spring Step and Lilac Sky are two female Pegasus ponies who appear in Rainbow Falls as cheerleaders for the Equestria Games qualifying team representing Cloudsdale. They are unnamed in the show, only collectively referred to as "Cloudsdale Cheer Ponies" in credits, but they are named individually in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name:
Crescent Pony
Mane Moon
characters.description: Mane Moon, also known as Crescent Moon and Crescent Pony, is a male background Pegasus pony with a light brown coat, darker brown mane, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a waxing crescent moon. Neither his name nor his title is given on the show, but they are used by merchandise, other media, and promotional material. He shares his design with Buddy, S05E05 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #1, and sometimes "Thorn", and he shares his mane and tail style with Dr. Hooves (whom he also has a similar color scheme to), Lucky Clover, and Meadow Song.

characters.name:
Cloudsdale Cheer Pony
Spring Step
characters.description: Spring Step and Lilac Sky are two female Pegasus ponies who appear in Rainbow Falls as cheerleaders for the Equestria Games qualifying team representing Cloudsdale. They are unnamed in the show, only collectively referred to as "Cloudsdale Cheer Ponies" in credits, but they are named individually in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name: Tight Ship
characters.description: Appears in Rainbow Falls as a coordinator on the Cloudsdale team, wearing a pair of headphones with a microphone. He wears a suit, so his cutie mark is not seen. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game The Crystal Games expansion set card #58 R, which gives him the description "Tight Ship is responsible for scheduling training and performances for the Wonderbolts. Spitfire has learned that with him in charge, everything goes exactly as scheduled." Also mentioned in The Wonderbolts Academy Handbook.

characters.name: Whiplash
characters.description: Fast Clip and Whiplash are two male Pegasus ponies who first appear in Wonderbolts Academy as Spitfire's fellow academy drill instructors. They are unnamed in the show, but they are named in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name: Angel Wings
characters.description: Angel Wings is a female Pegasus pony who appears in the season six episode Top Bolt as one of the Wonderbolt Academy trainees. She has a grayish cream coat, a light brown mane with bright red streaks, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a winged heart, and she wears a bright red bow in her mane and two red bracelets on her left foreleg.

characters.name: Bulk Biceps
characters.description: Bulk Biceps is a male Pegasus pony who first appears in the episode Hurricane Fluttershy. He has a white coat, a dirty-blond mane, and intense red eyes. He has an extraordinarily muscular character model.

characters.name: Cloud Chaser
characters.description: The name Cloud Chaser is used to refer to two separate characters: a female Pegasus pony and a male Pegasus pony.

characters.name:
Determined Shopper
Cloud Kicker
characters.description: Cloud Kicker is a female Pegasus pony with a lavender blue coat, jasmine mane and tail with a lemon chiffon streak, orchid eyes and a cutie mark of a cloud covering a sun. She shares her design with Merry May, shares her mane style with Lily Valley, and bears a resemblance to "Cloudy Kicks", "Lavender Lace", and Lily Blossom. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name:
Lazy Fan
Derpy
characters.description: Derpy, also known as Muffins and Ditzy Doo, is a female Pegasus pony who was given the name Derpy Hooves by the show's internet following due to her cross-eyed "derpy" expression in the first episode. The name has since been adopted by the crew and Hasbro. Starting with Feeling Pinkie Keen, the show's crew began giving the pony crossed eyes intentionally and later gave her "Where's Waldo" type cameo appearances as a nod to the fans. The character is addressed by Rainbow Dash in The Last Roundup as Derpy, where she speaks for the first time. The scene was later altered so Rainbow no longer names Derpy, in addition to her voice being altered and eyes being less crossed. She is called Bubbly Mare or Party Filly, among various others, in some merchandise, and she is called Lazy Fan in some other media. She shares her design with Sunshower Raindrops.

characters.name:
Fun-Loving Trainee
Feather Twirl
characters.description: Appears in Top Bolt as one of the Wonderbolt Academy trainees. Also appears in The Ending of the End - Part 2. Shares her body model and eye color with S07E19 Unnamed Earth Mare #2 and her body model with "Frazzle Rock" and S08E01 Unnamed Earth Mare #0. Her cutie mark is a whirling feather. She is a character called "Fun-Loving Trainee" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Disciplined Trainee
Hyacinth Dawn
characters.description: Appears in Top Bolt as one of the Wonderbolt Academy trainees. Her cutie mark is a yellow shining sun. She is a character called "Disciplined Trainee" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Icy Rain
characters.description: Appears as a Winter Wrap Up weather team member during Winter Wrap Up in Winter Wrap Up and with a lighter color scheme as a Wonderbolts Academy cadet in the magazine​[​specify​]​ comic Super Sub! Either she or Sunshower Raindrops appears in Forgotten Friendship. Shares her design and cutie mark with Sunshower Raindrops, Tropical Storm, and "Rain Dance". Her cutie mark is three raindrops.

characters.name: Lightning Dust
characters.description: Lightning Dust is a female Pegasus pony who first appears in the episode Wonderbolts Academy and makes subsequent appearances in later episodes, IDW comics, and magazines. Her cutie mark usually consists of a lightning bolt and three stars. She leaves a blue and yellow thunderbolt streak behind her when she flies, similar to Rainbow Dash's rainbow streak and the Wonderbolts' trail of lightning clouds. She is called Lighting Dust in The Elements of Harmony Vol. II guidebook.

characters.name: Lime Jelly
characters.description: Appears in Wonderbolts Academy. Has the same design as Sunshower Raindrops and Derpy. Her cutie mark appears to be umbrellas.

characters.name:
Cadet #2
Meadow Flower
characters.description: Meadow Flower is a female Pegasus pony with a pink coat, two-tone yellow mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a sunflower. She appears in the season three episode Wonderbolts Academy with a speaking role. She is unnamed in the series, credited as "Cadet #2" in the aforementioned episode, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Midnight Strike
characters.description: Appears in Wonderbolts Academy. Her name is not mentioned in the show, but has been stated by art director Ridd Sorensen on Twitter. Midnight Strike originated as an OC of one of Sorensen's family members. Her cutie mark is a very dark cloud with a lightning bolt.

characters.name: Mountain Haze
characters.description: Appears in Top Bolt as one of the Wonderbolt Academy trainees. His cutie mark is a cloudy mountaintop.

characters.name: Orange Swirl
characters.description: Orange Swirl, or Dizzy Twister, is a female Pegasus pony with a light khaki coat, a pink mane and tail with a light pink streak, fuchsia rose eyes, and a cutie mark of three tornadoes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise. She is identical to Sugar Twist apart from her mane colors, and shares her design with Rainbowshine. She has speaking roles in Lesson Zero and in Rainbow Falls.

characters.name: Parasol
characters.description: Parasol is a female Pegasus pony with a light yellow coat, wisteria mane and tail, web orange eyes, and a cutie mark of three purple umbrellas. She shares her design with Sassaflash. She is unnamed in the series, but she is named in other media.

characters.name:
Open Friendship Student
Pizzelle
characters.description: Pizzelle, or Pizelle, is a female background Pegasus pony with a yellowish white coat, golden mane and tail, lime green or light cyan eyes, and a cutie mark sometimes of three cookies, one with a bite taken out of it, and sometimes of two feathers. She is unnamed in the series, but she is named in other media and merchandise.

characters.name: Rainbow Drop
characters.description: Appears in Wonderbolts Academy. Has the same design as Wild Fire and Meadow Flower, and has a similar color scheme to Rainbowshine, S01E14 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #5, "Swirly Cotton", "Northern Lights", "Amethyst Beat", S04E20 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, Sweetsong, Star Dasher, and Bright Bridle. Her cutie mark appears to be blue drops.

characters.name: Rainbow Swoop
characters.description: Rainbow Swoop, or Purple Waters, is a background Pegasus pony with a light bluish-purple coat, dark gray mane, sea green eyes, and a cutie mark of a purple, orange, and yellow-striped rainbow. He is not named on the show, but he is named "Rainbow Swoop" with a trademark symbol and "Purple Waters" in different merchandise.

characters.name: Rolling Thunder
characters.description: Appears in The Washouts as a member of the titular stunt team. Shares her body type with Pinny Lane, S04E11 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, "Foxxy Trot", "Ice Mirror", "Viola", "Buzzsaw McColt", "Hacksaw McColt", "Crosscut McColt", "Slapshot", S06E20 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #4, S06E21 Unnamed Earth Mare #0, "Twirly Whirly", and S07E14 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1. Voiced by Rhona Rees. [1]​[​specify​]​ She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Wonderbolt for a Day" event. Her bio states "Kicked out of Wonderbolt academy for "flagrant disregard for hazardous weather." Lightning is dangerous, mate!"

characters.name: Sassaflash
characters.description: Sassaflash, or Emerald Gem, is a female Pegasus pony with a pale turquoise coat, vanilla mane and tail, carrot orange eyes, and a cutie mark of two lightning bolts. She is not named in the show, however merchandise and other media respectively name her as Sassaflash with a trademark symbol and as Emerald Gem. She shares her design with Parasol. She has speaking lines in Testing Testing 1, 2, 3 and the chapter book Princess Cadance and the Spring Hearts Garden.

characters.name:
Determined Trainee
Short Fuse
characters.description: Appears in Top Bolt as one of the Wonderbolt Academy trainees. Also appears in The Washouts.​[​specify​]​ Shares his structure and eye color with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #11, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #14, and Big Daddy McColt. His cutie mark is an orange and yellow flame. He is a pair of characters called "Determined Trainee" and Short Fuse in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Wonderbolt for a Day" event. Voiced by Andrew McNee.

characters.name: Sightseer
characters.description: Appears in Wonderbolts Academy. Either this Pegasus or "Star Bright" appears in Just for Sidekicks. This Pegasus later appears in For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils. He resembles "Star Bright" except for pony kind and eye color, resembles Starry Eyes except for coat and mane and tail colors and sometimes eye color, resembles "Star Gazer" except for pony kind, mane, and tail and eye colors, resembles Compass Star except for coat and mane and tail colors and cutie mark, and shares his design with "The Tenth Doctor / Doctor Whooves #3" and—except mustache—S06E08 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #1. His cutie mark is a telescope.

characters.name: Sky Stinger
characters.description: Sky Stinger is a male Pegasus pony and Wonderbolts cadet who first appears in Top Bolt.

characters.name: Sprinkle Medley
characters.description:
Sprinkle Medley, also named Spring Melody and April Showers, is a female Pegasus pony with a Celeste coat, Persian green mane and tail, baby blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a raining white cloud. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

Sprinkle has a speaking role in Rainbow Falls, in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, and in the German version of The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000.

characters.name: Star Hunter
characters.description: Star Hunter, or Solar Wind, is a male background Pegasus pony with a dark blue coat, blue mane and eyes, and a cutie mark of a white Orion constellation. He is not named in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media. He shares his mane and tail designs with Twilight Sky, "Cosmic", Neon Lights, Dark Moon, S02E26 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1, "Purple Stuff", "Flank Sinatra", and sometimes the unicorn version of Shooting Star. In the episode A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2, he appears as an Earth pony.

characters.name: Starburst
characters.description: Starburst is a male background Pegasus pony with a pale yellow coat, red mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of a blue five-pointed star. He is unnamed in the series, but he is named in other media.

characters.name: Starry Eyes
characters.description: Starry Eyes is a male background Pegasus pony with a white coat, two-tone black mane and tail, gold eyes, and a cutie mark of a telescope. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Stormfeather
characters.description: Stormfeather is a male background Pegasus pony with a bluish gray coat, light yellow mane and tail, bluish gray eyes, and a cutie mark of a shooting star. He is unnamed in the series, but he is named in other media.

characters.name: Sunshower Raindrops
characters.description: Sunshower Raindrops is a female Pegasus pony with a jasmine coat, tiffany blue mane and tail, medium turquoise eyes, and a cutie mark of three raindrops. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise. She shares her design with Derpy and her color scheme with "Rainy Feather". Her name includes the name of fellow Pegasus mare Sunshower and as such is similar to those of G3 Earth pony mare Sunshower and G1 seapony filly Sun Shower.

characters.name: Thorn
characters.description: Thorn is the placeholder name of a male background Pegasus pony with a blue coat, yellow mane and tail, amber eyes, and a cutie mark of an airstream.

characters.name: Vapor Trail
characters.description: Vapor Trail is a female Pegasus pony and Wonderbolts cadet who first appears in Top Bolt.

characters.name: Warm Front
characters.description: Warm Front is a male background Pegasus pony with a light brown coat, orange mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of three blue horseshoes or raindrops. He is unnamed in the series, but he is named in other media.

characters.name:
Knowledgeable Shopper
White Lightning
characters.description: White Lightning is a female background Pegasus pony with a white coat, light cerulean mane, light cyan eyes and a cutie mark of a dark cloud with a lightning bolt. She shares her design with Sprinkle Medley and bears a resemblance to Periwinkle. In Magical Mystery Cure and Pinkie Pride, she appears as an Earth pony. She is not named in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Whitewash
characters.description: Whitewash is a male background Pegasus pony with a white coat, blue mane and tail, gold eyes, and a cutie mark of a purple umbrella. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Wild Fire
characters.description: Wild Fire is a female background Pegasus pony who first appears in Twilight Sparkle's flashback in A Canterlot Wedding - Part 1. She has a pale amber coat, a dark brown mane, brown eyes, and a flaming tire cutie mark. She is an original character of Sabrina Alberghetti, and she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Abradacanter
characters.description: Appears in Rainbow Falls helping on the Cloudsdale team. Her cutie mark is not seen.

characters.name: Amelia Airhoof
characters.description: Appears in Newbie Dash as a flight school instructor in Rainbow Dash's flashback. Her design was one of multiple conceptual Surprise designs for Friendship is Magic, part 1.

characters.name: Aqua Burst
characters.description: Appears in Top Bolt as Sky Stinger's mother. Her cutie mark is a burst effect.

characters.name: Big Bell
characters.description: Appears in Buckball Season as the Pegasus defender on the Appleloosa buckball team. Also appears in The End in Friend. Shares her body design partly with Bulk Biceps, "Mama Biceps", "Two Ton", and Issue 13 Unnamed Stallion - Arrowed Heart. Her cutie mark is a kettlebell with a red heart on it.

characters.name: Big Shot
characters.description: Several paparazzi ponies appear in various episodes in the series, including Earth ponies Long Shot and Snappy Scoop, unicorn Press Release, and Pegasi Big Shot, Eff Stop, and Tracy Flash. They are unnamed in the show, "Tracy Flash" being a placeholder name, but some are named varyingly in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name: Blue Buck
characters.description: Briefly appears during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, with her eyes closed. Also appears in Magical Mystery Cure, with her eyes open. Shares her design with Derpy, Sunshower Raindrops, "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin", High Spirits, "Fuchsia Gems", Tropical Storm, S04E24 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2, and "Bluebell" and has a similar color scheme to "Chip Mint". She is named in the twenty-first wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Blue Buck, "She likes swimming with friends." Her cutie mark is two blue fish.

characters.name: Blue Diamond
characters.description: Seen watching Trixie in Boast Busters and Magic Duel, tinted. Shares her design with Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", Honey Rays, "Graceful Falls", "Cinnamon Swirl", S02E18 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, "Downdraft", "Sandstorm", and "Blue Emerald". Her cutie mark is three overlapping blue diamond shapes.

characters.name: Blue Emerald
characters.description: Part of Rainbow Dash's team in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design with Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", Honey Rays, "Graceful Falls", "Cinnamon Swirl", S02E18 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, "Downdraft", "Blue Diamond", and "Sandstorm". A texture matching her color scheme has been included in the Gameloft mobile game's type01_master_03.pvr file.

characters.name: Blue October / Blueberry Muffin
characters.description: Appears in Friendship is Magic, part 2, in The Ticket Master, in Boast Busters, in The Show Stoppers, in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, in Pinkie Pride, with a visible cutie mark in Simple Ways, with a visible cutie mark varying between a tornado and a gemstone in It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, with a visible cutie mark in Equestria Games, with a visible cutie mark of bubbles in On Your Marks, with a visible cutie mark of bubbles in Newbie Dash, in The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, in Parental Glideance, in Yakity-Sax, in Road to Friendship, in The Washouts, in 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, in The Summer Sun Setback, and on the IDW comics' Friends Forever Issue #23 page 4. Shares the same design as Derpy, Sunshower Raindrops, Blue Buck, High Spirits, "Fuchsia Gems", Tropical Storm, S04E24 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2, and "Bluebell".

characters.name: Bluebell
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy at the racetrack, and in Rainbow Falls at the Games tryouts. Either she with red mane and tail and blue eyes or S03E07 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3 with the design and eye color of "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin" appears in The Washouts. Shares her design with Derpy, Sunshower Raindrops, "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin", Blue Buck, High Spirits, "Fuchsia Gems", Tropical Storm, and S04E24 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2, and shares her coat and mane colors and cutie mark with "Thorn". Her cutie mark is a cartoon cloud.

characters.name: Blueberry Banana
characters.description: Appears in Equestria Games. Shares her design with Rainbowshine and Orange Swirl, and resembles "Bluebell" and Prim Posy.

characters.name: Blueberry Cloud
characters.description: Appears in Cloudsdale in Sonic Rainboom and Enterplay collectible card game Canterlot Nights expansion set card #41 C of Purple Waters. Has the same design and cutie mark design as White Lightning, "Turquoise Thunder", and S01E04 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2, the same design and sometimes cutie mark design as Jetstream, the same design as Sprinkle Medley and "Pink Cloud", and the same coat, eye, and partly mane colors as Minuette. Her cutie mark is a cloud with a lightning bolt.

characters.name: Blueberry Punch
characters.description: Seen at the weather factory in Sonic Rainboom. Also appears in Parental Glideance.

characters.name: Bluebird Happiness
characters.description: Seen in one scene in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design with Sassaflash, except for her mane color being green rather than vanilla and her coat color being darker.

characters.name: Bon Voyage
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy at the race track measuring her wing power, and during both attempts to form the tornado. Also appears in Rainbow Falls. Shares her mane style and cutie mark with Cloud Kicker and "Spring Skies", shares her mane style with Merry May, Lily Valley, Sunny Rays, "Sky Sweeper", "Velvet Light", and "Skyra", and resembles Sweetie Drops and Glamour Gleam in coat and mane colors. Her cutie mark is a cloud in front of a sun.

characters.name: Buddy
characters.description: Buddy is a male Pegasus pony with a green coat, gray mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of three four-leaf clovers, though, in Hurricane Fluttershy, he is seen with a white coat. He has a brief speaking role in the season six episode Applejack's "Day" Off. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in other media.

characters.name: Candy Floss
characters.description: Part of Rainbow Dash's team in Winter Wrap Up. Strongly resembles S06E07 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark with Rainbowshine and S06E07 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2, somewhat resembles Cozy Glow, and has a similar color scheme to Unnamed Girl #1.

characters.name: Cerulean Skies
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy while Twilight Sparkle tests her anemometer. Also appears in Princess Spike, Scare Master, The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, Common Ground, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 6. His mane and tail and cutie mark are the same as those of Crusoe Palm. His cutie mark is a palm tree. In Enterplay's collectible card game, he is named on his card α #8 C, which lists the quote "Up in the air is the only place I really feel at home, y'know?", and card α #44 C of High Spirits attributes to him the quote "Sometimes High Spirits can get so excited that she can't stand still. And by 'sometimes' I mean ALL the times."

characters.name: Chocolate Blueberry
characters.description: Her cutie mark is a lightning bolt. Has similar coat color, eye color, and cutie mark to Sassaflash.

characters.name: Cinnamon Swirl
characters.description: Briefly appears during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, with her eyes closed. Later appears in Magical Mystery Cure, with her eyes open. Also appears during the Cheese Confesses flashback in Pinkie Pride, with her eyes closed. Shares her design with Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", Honey Rays, "Graceful Falls", S02E18 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, "Downdraft", "Blue Diamond", "Sandstorm", and "Blue Emerald", and resembles S04E10 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1. Her cutie mark is an abstract spiral-like symbol.

characters.name: Cloud Break
characters.description: Appears in Sonic Rainboom. Same color scheme as Stormfeather.

characters.name: Cloud Showers
characters.description: Shares her design with Cloud Kicker. Her tail is a different color than her mane in Winter Wrap Up, but has the same color in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000. In Winter Wrap Up, her cutie mark is an umbrella.

characters.name: Compass Star
characters.description: Compass Star is a male Pegasus with an espresso coat, goldenrod mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of a yellow star surrounded by four white five-pronged smaller stars. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Cool Beans
characters.description: Appears in The Cutie Map - Part 2, To Where and Back Again - Part 1, To Where and Back Again - Part 2, and Hard to Say Anything. Shares his design with Stormfeather, "Silver Script", and S06E07 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #2 and his mane and tail style with Emerald Green. His cutie mark is a sun wearing sunglasses.

characters.name: Cosmic
characters.description: Appears in Rainbow Falls, Pinkie Pride, Princess Spike, Newbie Dash, Forever Filly, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, A Horse Shoe-In, and The Last Problem. A wingless version appears in Luna Eclipsed, in the same shot as a wingless version of Sprinkle Medley. Shares the same design as Twilight Sky and Star Hunter. His cutie mark is a crescent moon.

characters.name: Cotton Sky
characters.description: Appears in Brotherhooves Social as one of the competitors in the Sisterhooves Social, in A Hearth's Warming Tail, in The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, in Grannies Gone Wild, in Horse Play, in The Break Up Break Down, in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, in Between Dark and Dawn, in A Horse Shoe-In, in Growing Up is Hard to Do, in The Ending of the End - Part 2, and in The Last Problem. Shares her coat and mane colors with S08E09 Unnamed Earth Mare #1. Voiced by Katrina Salisbury in The Ending of the End - Part 2.

characters.name: Cream Tangerine
characters.description: A pony in the crowd at the Best Young Flyers competition in Sonic Rainboom.

characters.name: Descent
characters.description: Shadowbolts are a squad of Pegasus ponies similar to the Wonderbolts who were created by Nightmare Moon. They appear in the season episode Friendship is Magic, part 2 and some adaptations and merchandise. Their name is a portmanteau of the words "shadow" and "thunderbolt". Members of the Shadowbolts include Shadow Surprise and unnamed Pegasi.

characters.name: Desert Wind
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in School Daze - Part 1 as a board member of the Equestria Education Assocation, in Grannies Gone Wild, in Friendship University, in Between Dark and Dawn, and in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Shares his design and eye color with S07E22 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #3 and his design with "End Zone" and S08E14 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1. His cutie mark is two piles of hay and several wispy clouds.

characters.name: Dewdrop
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy, crashing out of the tornado when the first attempt fails, in Tanks for the Memories, and in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 3. His cutie mark is three raindrops.

characters.name: Downdraft
characters.description: Seen with turquoise eyes at the Grand Galloping Gala during The Best Night Ever and with purple eyes in a speaking role portraying Colonel Purple Dart during Testing Testing 1, 2, 3. Shares her design and cutie mark with Parasol, Prim Posy, and "Drizzle", shares her design with Sassaflash, Honey Rays, "Graceful Falls", "Cinnamon Swirl", S02E18 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, "Blue Diamond", "Sandstorm", and "Blue Emerald", and resembles Sugar Grape. Her cutie mark appears to be umbrellas.

characters.name: Drizzle
characters.description: Drizzle is the placeholder name of a female background Pegasus pony with a pale purple coat, sandy yellow mane and tail, pink eyes, and a cutie mark of three purple umbrellas. She has a brief speaking role in The Ticket Master.

characters.name: Dust Devil
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy after the successful creation of the tornado. She is one of the ponies carrying Fluttershy later in the episode.

characters.name: Dusty Swift
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8.

characters.name: Eff Stop
characters.description: Several paparazzi ponies appear in various episodes in the series, including Earth ponies Long Shot and Snappy Scoop, unicorn Press Release, and Pegasi Big Shot, Eff Stop, and Tracy Flash. They are unnamed in the show, "Tracy Flash" being a placeholder name, but some are named varyingly in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name: Electric Blue
characters.description: Has a similar color palette and cutie mark as the G1 pony Firefly. Shares the same design as Honey Rays and has a similar coat color, eye color, and cutie mark to Sassaflash. Her cutie mark is two yellow lightning bolts.

characters.name: Endless Clouds
characters.description: Seen cheering at the Best Young Flyer competition in Sonic Rainboom. Shares the same design as White Lightning. Her cutie mark is a cloud.

characters.name:
Horticultural Pegasus
Evergreen
characters.description: Appears as a landscaper cutting down dragon sneeze trees in Princess Spike. Also appears in The Point of No Return. His cutie mark is a pine tree. Voiced by Peter New. He is a character called "Horticultural Pegasus" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "This hardworking pony should keep his throat limber: He spends a good bit of his job yelling 'TIMBER!'"

characters.name: Flower Flight
characters.description: Appears, sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, To Where and Back Again - Part 1, To Where and Back Again - Part 2, and Hard to Say Anything. Shares her design with Sassaflash, Parasol, Honey Rays, Prim Posy, "Downdraft", "Riverdance", "Drizzle", "Cinnamon Swirl", S02E18 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, "Sandstorm", "Blue Diamond", "Graceful Falls", "Blue Emerald", "Electric Blue", "Bluebird Happiness", "Wind Chill", "Snowslide", S04E08 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1, S04E20 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1, S04E13 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1, "Tiger Lily", "Sky Flower", "Cream Tangerine", and S01E20 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2. Her cutie mark appears to be three yellow flowerbuds.

characters.name:
Swooning Pony 2
Fond Feather
characters.description: Appears in Hard to Say Anything as one of three ponies swooning over Feather Bangs. Also appears in Between Dark and Dawn. Has a similar color scheme to S04E08 Unnamed Earth Mare #17 and Radiant Hope. She is a character called "Giddy Fanfilly" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This pegasus has a secret collection of Feather Bangs fanfiction in her attic. The one where he defeats a bugbear with the power of song is particularly well-written!" Her cutie mark is two candles. Voiced by Rebecca Shoichet.

characters.name: Fuchsia Gems
characters.description: Appears in Rainbow Falls and Tanks for the Memories. Shares her design and eye color with Derpy and shares her design with Sunshower Raindrops, "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin", Blue Buck, High Spirits, Tropical Storm, S04E24 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2, and "Bluebell". Her cutie mark is three cut gemstones.

characters.name: Geronimo
characters.description: Appears in On Your Marks as a bungee spotter. Jim Miller has assumed that this pony and Tree Hugger are siblings.

characters.name: Golden Glory
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy at the racetrack and in Tanks for the Memories in Cloudsdale. Also appears in Dragon Dropped. Has the same mane and tail style and coat and eye colors as Lemon Hearts, the same mane and tail style and eye color as Apple Stars and Lilac Hearts, the same mane style and eye color as "Apple Bottom", and the same mane and tail style as Twinkleshine. Her cutie mark is a green laurel wreath. A November 6, 2013 "vorläufige Abbildung" image for mystery packs includes her.

characters.name: Graceful Falls
characters.description: Appears throughout the crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", Honey Rays, "Cinnamon Swirl", S02E18 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, "Downdraft", "Blue Diamond", "Sandstorm", and "Blue Emerald". Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show her more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Grape Soda
characters.description: Shares the same design and cutie mark as Derpy.

characters.name: Helia
characters.description: Helia is a female Pegasus pony with a light blue coat, a golden mane and tail with bright yellow highlights, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a sunflower. She is not named in the show, but she is named in merchandise. In The Crystal Empire - Part 2, she appears as an Earth pony.

characters.name: High Note
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy during the library meeting, in Games Ponies Play, in Rainbow Falls, in Pinkie Pride, in Testing Testing 1, 2, 3 with a speaking role portraying Commander Easyglider, in Trade Ya!, in A Hearth's Warming Tail, in A Royal Problem, in Triple Threat, in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, with a different mane style in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, in Student Counsel, and in The Last Problem. He resembles Royal Riff. His cutie mark is two white G-clefs. Voiced by Jayson Thiessen.

characters.name: High Spirits
characters.description: A pony seen amongst the crowds at the Iron Pony competition in Fall Weather Friends and the Best Young Flyer competition in Sonic Rainboom. Looks excited being there. Has the same design as Derpy, Sunshower Raindrops, "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin", Blue Buck, "Fuchsia Gems", Tropical Storm, S04E24 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2, and "Bluebell" and similar coat and mane colors to Fluttershy and G1 Patch. She is named on her Enterplay collectible card game card α #44 C, which shows her with a light-green coat and darker shades for her mane and eyes and attributes to Cerulean Skies the quote "Sometimes High Spirits can get so excited that she can't stand still. And by 'sometimes' I mean ALL the times."

characters.name: Honey Rays
characters.description: Honey Rays is a background Pegasus pony mare with a pink coat, sandy yellow mane and tail, orange eyes, and a cutie mark of two lightning bolts. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Huckleberry
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The End in Friend, Road to Friendship, The Washouts, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, She's All Yak, Student Counsel, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, The Ending of the End - Part 2, Teacher of the Month, the Signature My Little Pony magazine issue 102 comic Underwater memories, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. His cutie mark is three purple mangosteens.

characters.name: Jack Hammer
characters.description: Jack Hammer, or Drill Bit, is a male background pony who appears both as a Pegasus and as an Earth pony. He has a light brown coat, two-toned dark gray mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark usually of a screwdriver and two screws and rarely of a police shield. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named "Jack Hammer" with a trademark symbol and "Drill Bit" in various merchandise and other media. He has a speaking role in The Mysterious Mare Do Well.

characters.name: Jetstream
characters.description: Jetstream, or Jet Stream, is a female background Pegasus pony with a pink coat, light red mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark sometimes of a white cloud with light red rain and other times of a pink cloud with a yellow lightning bolt. She is not named in the show, but she is named in merchandise, and her name is used in other media.

characters.name: Juicy Fruit
characters.description: She appears worn out after the Running of the Leaves in Fall Weather Friends, and at the first fashion show in Suited for Success. Has the same color scheme and cutie mark as Berryshine.

characters.name: Laurette
characters.description: Appears in Games Ponies Play during Rainbow Dash's Cloudsdale flashback, announcing the location of the Equestria Games. Also appears in Parental Glideance and in a picture with her name listed on the IDW comics' Friends Forever Issue #18 regular cover. She closely resembles Dane Tee Dove. Her cutie mark is a purple laurel wreath.

characters.name: Lavender Skies
characters.description: Almost identical to Parasol. Her cutie mark is a sun and a cloud.

characters.name: Lavender Sunrise
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, in Once Upon a Zeppelin, in Grannies Gone Wild, and as an Earth pony in A Rockhoof and a Hard Place. Shares her design with S08E14 Unnamed Earth Mare #4 and S09E05 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #5. Her cutie mark is a sunrise.

characters.name:
Audience Pony
Lemon Lime
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, in Friendship University, in which she has a speaking role, in Common Ground, in Between Dark and Dawn, in 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, in The Last Problem, and in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Lightning Riff
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. His cutie mark is a guitar and lightning bolt.

characters.name:
Announcer Pony
Madden
characters.description: The announcer at the Best Young Flyers Competition in Sonic Rainboom. Mentioned on the IDW comics' Friends Forever Issue #18 regular cover. Named in The Wonderbolts Academy Handbook. He is a character called "Announcer Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "There are only two things this pony cares about in this world: his personal style, and his day job as an announcer. It's good to have priorities."

characters.name: Mama Biceps
characters.description: Appears in Equestria Games, next to "Cloverbelle". Resembles Bulk Biceps—whose human counterpart's mom is mentioned in My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Legend of Everfree—and shares her body design with "Two Ton" and partly "Big Bell" and Issue 13 Unnamed Stallion - Arrowed Heart.

characters.name: Merry May
characters.description: Merry May is a female Pegasus pony with a spring bud coat, plum mane and tail with a lavender pink streak, amaranth pink eyes, and a cutie mark of three suns. She has not been named in the show, but she has a name in merchandise. She is identical to Sunny Rays apart from her coat color, shares her design with Cloud Kicker, and shares her mane style with Lily Valley.

characters.name: Mind Freak
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus depicted in poster at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Bears a resemblance to Criss Angel.

characters.name: Moonlight Zephyr
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Once Upon a Zeppelin, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8.

characters.name: Muggy Air
characters.description: Appears during the pageant performance in Hearth's Warming Eve, at the summit of the tribes. She resembles Sunshower Raindrops except for her mane color.

characters.name: Nightingale
characters.description: Shadowbolts are a squad of Pegasus ponies similar to the Wonderbolts who were created by Nightmare Moon. They appear in the season episode Friendship is Magic, part 2 and some adaptations and merchandise. Their name is a portmanteau of the words "shadow" and "thunderbolt". Members of the Shadowbolts include Shadow Surprise and unnamed Pegasi.

characters.name:
Pegasus Dad
Nightjar
characters.description: Zipporwhill's father who appears in Filli Vanilli, Ponyville Mysteries: The Tail of the Timberwolf, and on the season 4 poster. Shares his tail style and beard style with Walter and "Duce Switchell", and shares his tail style with Cratus and "Lockdown". Officially named in a Hasbro YouTube channel video. His cutie mark is an acoustic guitar. Voiced by Peter New.

characters.name: Northern Lights
characters.description: A pony seen running in the weather factory in Sonic Rainboom, trying to catch snowflakes, and also seen in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Resembles Rainbowshine, has the same design as S04E08 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2, and has a similar color scheme to S01E14 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #5, "Swirly Cotton", "Rainbow Drop", "Amethyst Beat", S04E20 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, Sweetsong, Star Dasher, and Bright Bridle.

characters.name: Nurse Fahrenheit
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a nurse pony at the Ponyville Hospital. His cutie mark is a thermometer.

characters.name: Parula
characters.description: Appears in the ceremony in The Return of Harmony Part 2. Has the same mane style as Fluttershy, "Crescendo", Diamond Rose, and Issue 22 Unnamed Mare - Lightning Bolt, and a similar color scheme to S04E08 Unnamed Earth Mare #3. Her eye color and cutie mark are not shown.

characters.name:
Pony Student 3
Patty Peppermint
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, Friendship University, The End in Friend, Road to Friendship, The Washouts, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, Sparkle's Seven, She's All Yak, Student Counsel, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, A Trivial Pursuit, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, Daring Doubt, The Ending of the End - Part 1, The Ending of the End - Part 2, Teacher of the Month, Starlight the Hypnotist, the Signature My Little Pony magazine issue 102 comic Underwater memories, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares her color scheme with BGE Unnamed Earth Filly #1. Her cutie mark is three interlocked gold rings. She is a character called "Cute Friendship Student" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game description states, "Taking a page out of Rarity's lesson plan, this filly has decided that one of HER first rules of friendship is adorable mane accessories!" Voiced by Nicole Oliver in School Raze.

characters.name: Pink Cloud
characters.description: Appears in Applejack's fantasy in The Ticket Master, in Boast Busters, in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, in Putting Your Hoof Down, in Pinkie Pride, with her cutie mark visible in Simple Ways, in Filli Vanilli, and in No Second Prances. Shares the same design as Sprinkle Medley, White Lightning, Jetstream, "Turquoise Thunder", "Blueberry Cloud", and S01E04 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #2. A November 6, 2013 "vorläufige Abbildung" image for mystery packs includes her, without her cutie mark.

characters.name: Prim Posy
characters.description: Prim Posy is a female Pegasus pony with a grayish blue coat, pale yellow mane and tail, orange eyes, and a cutie mark of three purple umbrellas.

characters.name: Prism Glider
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy during the second attempt to form the tornado, in Rainbow Falls, and in Equestria Games. Has the same design and cutie mark as Rainbow Swoop. His cutie mark is a purple, orange, and yellow-striped rainbow. A mini-figure toy and a collector card of him are packaged together as part of the ninth wave of mystery packs. According to the card, he "glides across the sky with his friends!" His name comes both from the card and from the packaging of the wave, which each list the name as a trademark.

characters.name: Pumpkin Tart
characters.description: Appears in Sonic Rainboom watching the Best Young Flyer competition.

characters.name: Q. T. Prism
characters.description: Appears in Winter Wrap Up. Her cutie mark is a rainbow.

characters.name: Rain Dance
characters.description: Part of Rainbow Dash's team in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark with Sunshower Raindrops, and her coat and partly mane colors with Orange Swirl and "Candy Mane". Her cutie mark is three water drops.

characters.name: Rainbow Blaze
characters.description: Rainbow Blaze is a male Pegasus pony and "mentor" of Rainbow Dash who appears in the episodes Games Ponies Play and A Hearth's Warming Tail. He has a pale periwinkle coat, a rainbow-striped mane and tail, amber eyes, and a cutie mark in most materials of what appears to be a multicolored airstream through cloud(s) and in Gameloft's mobile game of a five-pointed object with a rainbow streak. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name:
Inquisitive Shopper
Rainbowshine
characters.description: Rainbowshine is a female Pegasus pony with a wisteria coat, pink lace mane and tail with baby pink streaks, charm pink eyes, and a cutie mark of a rainbow. The show does not name her, but she receives her name from merchandise. She shares her design with Orange Swirl, and she has a similar color scheme to S01E14 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #5, "Swirly Cotton", "Rainbow Drop", "Northern Lights", "Amethyst Beat", S04E20 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, Sweetsong, Star Dasher, and Bright Bridle. She has brief speaking roles in Winter Wrap Up, Sonic Rainboom, Rainbow Falls, and Leap of Faith.

characters.name: Rainy Day
characters.description: Appears in The Break Up Break Down as a mailpony at the Ponyville post office. Also appears in Road to Friendship with a speaking role. Her cutie mark is a raincloud. Voiced by Janyse Jaud.

characters.name: Ray Stinger
characters.description: Appears in Top Bolt as Sky Stinger's father. His cutie mark is a white cloud and yellow lightning bolt.

characters.name: Record High
characters.description: Appears as the judge for the Appleloosa rodeo's hay bale stacking event in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Her cutie mark is a red ribbon.

characters.name: Redwood Oak
characters.description: Appears, sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, and To Where and Back Again - Part 1. Shares his design with Starburst, Warm Front, "Cloud Break", "Serenity", "High Note", S05E01 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #1, "Dewdrop", "Sunlight", and "Silverwing" and his mane and tail style with Caramel. Storyboarded as an Alicorn.

characters.name: Riverdance
characters.description: Seen talking to "Serena" in The Best Night Ever. Her cutie mark is three umbrellas.

characters.name: Rocky Storm
characters.description: Appears, sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, To Where and Back Again - Part 1, Rock Solid Friendship, and a European magazine comic whose French title is Une leçon d'amitié. Shares her design with Silverspeed, her mane and tail style with Lyra Heartstrings, and her cutie mark design with S05E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4. Her cutie mark is blue cotton candy.

characters.name: Rosewing
characters.description: A pony in the crowd at the Best Young Flyers competition in Sonic Rainboom.

characters.name: Sandstorm
characters.description: Seen watching Trixie in Boast Busters and Magic Duel, tinted. Shares her design with Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", Honey Rays, "Graceful Falls", "Cinnamon Swirl", S02E18 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, "Downdraft", "Blue Diamond", and "Blue Emerald". Her cutie mark is an hourglass.

characters.name:
Snide Bully
Score
characters.description: The Boy Bullies are a group of up to three male Pegasi, including Hoops, Dumb-bell, and Score, who have picked on Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy, calling them respectively "Rainbow Crash" and "Klutzershy". The three first appear as grown stallions in the season one episode Sonic Rainboom, and they make varying appearances as stallions and colts in later episodes, chapter books, and IDW comics. The two other than Hoops are not named in the show, but the three's collective title and individual names are given in merchandise.

characters.name: Serenity
characters.description: Serenity is the placeholder name of a male background Pegasus pony with a pink coat, dark blue (sometimes bright yellow) mane and tail, grayish blue eyes, and a cutie mark of three raindrops.

characters.name: Silver Script
characters.description: Silver Script is the placeholder name of a male background Pegasus pony with a purple coat, gray mane and tail, bluish gray eyes, and a cutie mark of a scroll.

characters.name: Silverspeed
characters.description: Silverspeed is a female Pegasus pony who first appears in the season two episode Hurricane Fluttershy. She has a gray coat, light gray mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a light blue bow and arrow.

characters.name: Silverwing
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy after the successful attempt to form the tornado.

characters.name: Sky Flower
characters.description: Seen at the Grand Galloping Gala during The Best Night Ever. Shares her design with Parasol, "Drizzle", and Prim Posy.

characters.name: Sky Sweeper
characters.description: Appears in Rainbow Falls and Tanks for the Memories. Shares her design with Merry May, Cloud Kicker, Sunny Rays, "Spring Skies", "Velvet Light", and "Skyra", and shares her mane style with Lily Valley and "Bon Voyage".

characters.name: Skyra
characters.description: Appears in Cloudsdale in Sonic Rainboom, in Ponyville in On Your Marks, in Ponyville in Newbie Dash, and on Enterplay collectible card game Canterlot Nights expansion set card #41 C of Purple Waters. Has the same design and cutie mark as Merry May, Sunny Rays, and "Velvet Light", the same design as Cloud Kicker, "Sky Sweeper", and "Spring Skies", the same mane style as Lily Valley and "Bon Voyage", and the same color scheme as Lyra Heartstrings. Her cutie mark appears to be suns.

characters.name: Slipstream
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy during both attempts to create the tornado, with a speaking role saying "I think it was Fluttershy!" after "Serenity" asks "What was that?" A similar pony appears on the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #2 page 1. Resembles Orange Swirl in general appearance and tornadoes cutie mark, and Merry May in color scheme.

characters.name: Snow Violet
characters.description: Appears in The Break Up Break Down as a mailpony at the Ponyville post office. Also appears in Road to Friendship with a speaking role. Her cutie mark is a white-petaled flower. Voiced by Kelly Sheridan.

characters.name: Snowslide
characters.description: Seen in Winter Wrap Up shoveling snow off of a roof.

characters.name:
Confident Friendship Student
Soaring Virtue
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, She's All Yak, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, and The Ending of the End - Part 2 as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares her mane and tail style and eye color with S07E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #1 and "Power Chord". Her cutie mark is a pink hummingbird. She is a character called "Confident Friendship Student" in Gameloft's mobile game, and she serves as an enemy minion during the School Raze-based event. Her in-game description states, "Ever since she enrolled, she's resolved to be the very best at friendship that anypony ever was! Celestia knows, she's got a lot to live up to..."

characters.name: Special Delivery
characters.description: Makes a speaking appearance in Wonderbolts Academy, delivering Rainbow Dash her letter to join the Wonderbolt Academy. Makes two more speaking appearances credited as "Messenger Pony" and voiced by Peter New in Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 1, delivering letters to Twilight Sparkle. Makes another speaking appearance in Daring Don't, voiced by Brian Drummond, and another in School Raze - Part 1, voiced by Gavin Langelo. Has the same color scheme as Starburst and "Nolan North". He is a character called "Pegasus Courier" in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night will stay him from his appointed rounds... because Pegasi are in charge of making the weather!"

characters.name: Spiral Notepad
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention cosplaying as Daring Do. Shares her body model with Gizmo, "Street Rat", "Burdock Hooffield", "Ginger Locks", and S09E22 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2. Her cutie mark is a notebook.

characters.name: Spring Skies
characters.description: Appears in Hurricane Fluttershy after the successful creation of the tornado. She is one of the ponies carrying Fluttershy later in the episode. She also appears in Tanks for the Memories. Shares her design and cutie mark with Cloud Kicker, shares her mane style and cutie mark with "Bon Voyage", shares her design with Merry May, Sunny Rays, "Sky Sweeper", "Velvet Light", and "Skyra", and shares her mane style with Lily Valley. Her cutie mark is a cloud in front of a sun.

characters.name: Steam Roller
characters.description: A cloud worker with a speaking role distracted by Rarity's wings in Sonic Rainboom. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, with a sometimes-detached cutie mark appearing to consist of an hourglass. A wingless version appears as a construction worker in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, Pinkie Pride, Fluttershy Leans In, Honest Apple, Triple Threat, The Maud Couple, Between Dark and Dawn, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, and My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #5 page 7, with a cutie mark consisting of a wrench and two screws. An Alicorn version appears in Grannies Gone Wild. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game Canterlot Nights expansion set card #38 C, which attributes to Drill Bit the quote "I saw a whole building collapse on him once and he walked away from it. I mean, the building was made out of clouds, but it was still pretty impressive."

characters.name:
Vapor's Dad
Steer Straight
characters.description: Appears in Top Bolt as Vapor Trail's father. Shares his body style and eye color with Toe-Tapper and S06E13 Unnamed Earth Stallion #8. His cutie mark is a steering wheel. Voiced by Peter Kelamis.

characters.name: Stormbreaker
characters.description: Appears as ice archer number seven from Cloudsdale in Equestria Games, during which Rainbow Dash states that he's "the favorite." Mentioned on the IDW comics' Friends Forever Issue #18 regular cover. He is named in the twenty-fourth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Stormbreaker, "He plays ice archery with friends." Shares his design and eye color with Thunderlane.

characters.name: Strawberry Sunrise
characters.description: Strawberry Sunrise, or Sweetie Sunrise, is a female Pegasus pony with a pale goldenrod coat, pale, light amaranth mane, dark olive green eyes, and a varying cutie mark at least of a strawberry. She is named Strawberry Sunrise in Honest Apple and both Strawberry Sunrise and "Sweetie Sunrise" in different merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Sugar Apple
characters.description: Seen at the weather factory in Sonic Rainboom. Looks similar to Starsong.

characters.name: Sugar Maple
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, A Matter of Principals, The Hearth's Warming Club, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, She's All Yak, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, Daring Doubt, The Ending of the End - Part 2, The Last Problem, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares his mane and tail style with Swanky Hank. His cutie mark is a red maple leaf.

characters.name: Sugar Twist
characters.description: Watches Rarity's fashion show in Suited For Success and watches Sapphire Shores in its partial adaptation Rarity Loves Fashion. Identical to Orange Swirl in all but mane color. Her cutie mark is three tornadoes. She is named on her Enterplay collectible card game card α #79 C, which gives her the description "Sugar Twist earned her cutie mark when she made the largest tornado ever seen on the Ponyville school playground. She also earned two weeks of detention." In the game's expansion set Canterlot Nights, card #15 C of Orange Swirl gives Orange Swirl the description "Orange Swirl once beat Sugar Twist's record for biggest tornado on Ponyville school grounds. Spending the following week clapping erasers after school was totally worth it."

characters.name: Sugarshine
characters.description: Appears in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2. A similar pony appears on the IDW comics' Friendship is Magic Issue #28 page 1. Shares her design with Rainbowshine and Orange Swirl.

characters.name: Sunlight
